channel.title: [PI] ItemDefinitions from JSON + ItemDef editor

item.title: [PI] ItemDefinitions from JSON + ItemDef editor
item.dc:creator: @Freesunfury Freesunfury
item.description:
@Freesunfury wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:30, topic:545043”]https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,556454.0.html
Make it yourself.[/quote]

Yeah I’m new to java but how’s this.

[code]
public enum WieldType {
/**
* A wield type that represents an item in the hat (head) slot.
*/
HAT(0),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the cape (back) slot.
 */
CAPE(1),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the shield slot.
 */
SHIELD(5),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the gloves (hands) slot.
 */
GLOVES(9),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the boots (feet) slot.
 */
BOOTS(10),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the amulet (neck) slot.
 */
AMULET(2),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the ring (finger) slot.
 */
RING(12),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the arrow (projectile) slot.
 */
ARROWS(13),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the body slot.
 */
BODY(4),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the legs slot.
 */
LEGS(7),

/**
 * A wield type that represents an item in the weapon (hand) slot.
 */
WEAPON(3);

/**
 * The slot in which an item will be contained
 */
private final int slot;

WieldType(final int slot) {
	this.slot = slot;
}

public int getSlot() {
	return this.slot;
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ItemDefinitions from JSON + ItemDef editor
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:21, topic:545043”]your ui is rather messy.

i know you dont have much experience with ui’s, but you should definitely practice more.

i came up with this layout.

so start practicing mate. and let me know if you need any help.[/quote]
The layout manager I was using wanted to be a cunt for most of the time. I’d add 1 more object in and it’d cause everything to go offset by like 80 pixels, so I was constantly fixing that.
I was actually working on a redesign, but I never finished it (due to a few reasons). I do want to redeisgn it though.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ItemDefinitions from JSON + ItemDef editor
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

using a the Object structure instead of parallel arrays in this causes an extra 4*(arraysize) bytes. Then you can construct the ItemDefinition object by value, and save memory space by converting the boolean’s to byte arrays. 3*(arraysize) bytes

Then in the ItemDefinition you could keep it as a boolean for easy referencing.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ItemDefinitions from JSON + ItemDef editor
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:19, topic:545043”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663922.msg4448976#msg4448976 date=1410281575]

I wrote something kind of similar to this Except it more parses and edits the original cache(correctly). It is still too ugly to release though

Currently only handles ItemDef’s but will be expanding it with knowledge to encompass everything within the cache. (Including model construction and modification)
Here’s to high hopes :chug:

So your point to responding on my thread was to brag about your system? mmk…

I mean, that’s cool and all, Just not seeing the point.
[/quote]

Your right i removed the post. I was talking something client sided anyways, didn’t even parallel correctly. I got sidetracked from the help to the snippet section lol. :|[/quote]
XP it’s okay. Maybe if you clean up yours you can release it too :P.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ItemDefinitions from JSON + ItemDef editor
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:16, topic:545043”]inb4 primitive lovers.

Why would you limit the array to the amount of definitions you are loading now?
In the future you could want to use a file that has more or less definitions,
so just use a List for it?[/quote]
I modified my actual version that I’m using, I tend to forget to update snippets, if I even get it before the time limit.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] ItemDefinitions from JSON + ItemDef editor
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Dan0194, post:11, topic:545043”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=663922.msg4438908#msg4438908 date=1405910138]

lol at that constructor. you know you should of just done it through the cache, then instead of all the unnecessary loops etc you can just do

public String getItemName(int ItemID) { ItemDefinition def = ItemCache.get(ItemID); if (def == null) { return "Unarmed"; } return def.getName(); }

I think the json filed just contained more data than the cache gave.

Lol if it didn’t contain it, there’s at least a slot for it.
Special price can be used to replace that shitty method that the standard PI has for converting special prices (yeah, that huge switch statement, you know what I’m talking about) for shops that take alternate credits.
[/quote]

no no I was replying back to when he said why didn’t you use the cache to load all of this data.[/quote]
Yeah I know, I was just saying that I found that a good portion of data is actually missing.

Whomever uses this: Have fun with stat requirements.

Read full topic
